As with most tech products, [Black Friday sales](https://www.engadget.com/deals/black-friday-2025-deals-from-amazon-apple-lego-ninja-and-more-are-ready-to-shop-now-ahead-of-the-years-biggest-sale-100052033.html) are usually a good time to pick up any storage gear you’ve been eyeing. If you have a PC, [PS5](https://www.engadget.com/gaming/playstation/best-ssd-for-ps5-130004175.html), [gaming handheld](https://www.engadget.com/gaming/best-handheld-gaming-system-140018863.html) or any other gadget that could use some extra space, we’re weeding out the junk and rounding up the best Black Friday SSD deals and other storage discounts we could already find. So far we’re seeing a handful of discounts on well-reviewed [internal drives](https://www.engadget.com/computing/accessories/best-ssds-140014262.html), [portable SSDs](https://www.engadget.com/computing/accessories/best-portable-ssd-120043652.html) and [microSD cards](https://www.engadget.com/computing/accessories/best-microsd-card-130038282.html), but we expect many more deals to pop up over the next few days, so we'll update this post as we find more offers that are worth your time.

## Best Black Friday microSD card deals

[**PNY microSD Express Card (256GB) for $50 at Amazon ($10 off)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0F8PDR71R&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=PNY+microSD+Express+Card+%28256GB%29+for+%2450+at+Amazon+%28%2410+off%29&&signature=AQAAAfiL5KdjobLGN9dKG9mvhThAzsvvlq3bf3p1Ln7QYjmt&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FPNY-microSD-microSDXC-Compatible-Nintendo%2Fdp%2FB0F8PDR71R%2F): The only reason to buy a superfast microSD Express card right now is to expand the storage of a [Nintendo Switch 2](https://www.engadget.com/gaming/nintendo/switch-2/), which requires the newer format. In our guide to the [best Switch 2 microSD cards](https://www.engadget.com/gaming/nintendo/best-microsd-cards-for-nintendo-switch-2-160052947.html), we found each model we tested to perform similarly in actual games, so your best bet is to buy whichever one you can find in stock at the lowest price. Nintendo has [already announced](https://www.nintendo.com/us/whatsnew/nintendo-announces-holiday-offers-for-black-friday-and-cyber-monday-2025/) that [Samsung’s 256GB Express card](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0F3VTCZK8&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=Samsung%E2%80%99s+256GB+Express+card&custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2RwL0IwRjNWVENaSzg_dGFnPWdkZ3QwYy0yMCIsImNvbnRlbnRVdWlkIjoiMzM0MGM2ZTktNGY5Ny00ZTcyLTk2NGQtMzhhMGNlNGNmYjMwIiwib3JpZ2luYWxVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2RwL0IwRjNWVENaSzgiLCJkeW5hbWljQ2VudHJhbFRyYWNraW5nSWQiOnRydWUsInNpdGVJZCI6InVzLWVuZ2FkZ2V0IiwicGFnZUlkIjoiMXAtYXV0b2xpbmsiLCJmZWF0dXJlSWQiOiJ0ZXh0LWxpbmsifQ&signature=AQAAAWKkzIxOcS--uv4Gg2aPR2CjD4B4kOOcvzpjDgoN1l2K&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fdp%2FB0F3VTCZK8) will be available for “$20 off MSRP” on November 30, which should bring it down to $40. If you can wait to pounce on that offer, you should. But if you can’t for some reason, or if that deal quickly sells out, this is the lowest price we’ve tracked for PNY’s equivalent model.

[**SanDisk microSD Express Card (256GB) for $60 at Amazon ($8 off)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0DFQGVLYF&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=SanDisk+microSD+Express+Card+%28256GB%29+for+%2460+at+Amazon+%28%248+off%29&&signature=AQAAAZ9Q2ylH2ggIQovEYEExxCGo1_J0DcjYzNQdgt9qTWsu&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FSanDisk-256GB-microSD-Express-SDSQXFN-256G-GN4NN%2Fdp%2FB0DFQGVLYF): Likewise, this discount matches the best price we’ve seen for SanDisk’s 256GB microSD Express card. Again, there isn’t much point in grabbing it as long as cheaper options are in stock, though this is technically the fastest all-around model we’ve tested when it comes to transferring games to and from the Switch 2’s built-in storage. (Within games, however, the difference is still minimal.) We’ll note it here just in case the other Express models completely sell out.

## Best Black Friday internal SSD deals

[**SK Hynix Platinum P51 (1TB) PCIe 5.0 SSD for $110 at Newegg ($60 off)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=6ce976db-26d7-4094-a1be-4d1496b213f0&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Newegg&linkText=SK+Hynix+Platinum+P51+%281TB%29+PCIe+5.0+SSD+for+%24110+at+Newegg+%28%2460+off%29&&signature=AQAAATWhXORbD5kjoJ7Qht8OLOA4WadclPYdccJGlpNzRBel&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newegg.com%2Fsk-hynix-1tb-nvme%2Fp%2FN82E16820329025): Most people don’t have to pay extra for the top-tier performance of a PCIe 5.0 SSD like the Platinum P51, but if you need something for more intense workloads or just want comfort of owning a more futureproof SSD, [reviews](https://www.storagereview.com/review/sk-hynix-platinum-p51-review-balanced-performance-for-demanding-workloads) [around](https://www.techpowerup.com/review/sk-hynix-p51-platinum-2-tb/) [the web](https://www.pcmag.com/reviews/sk-hynix-platinum-p51) suggest this is one of the better options available. Just make sure you have a compatible motherboard first. This offer isn’t technically a Black Friday deal, as it expires on Thursday, but it ties the lowest price we’ve seen for the 1TB model. Use the code **BNE4643** to get the full discount at checkout.

[**Crucial T710 (2TB) PCIe 5.0 SSD for $180 at Amazon ($120 off)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0F9XMYR15&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=Crucial+T710+%282TB%29+PCIe+5.0+SSD+for+%24180+at+Amazon+%28%24120+off%29&&signature=AQAAASoXED16qcoJo_D7h5Ujyt_CfhYH44SfLFP4a9KW73Q-&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FInternal-Compatible-Software-Mac-OS-X%2Fdp%2FB0F9XMYR15): The T710 is Crucial’s successor to the T705. Most [reviews](https://www.tomshardware.com/pc-components/ssds/crucial-t710-2tb-ssd-review) [suggest](https://www.pcmag.com/reviews/crucial-t710) it isn’t a massive leap over the older version in real-world performance, but it’s generally faster, and it’s a more noticeable improvement in terms of power efficiency. If you’re willing to spend a little bit extra, this discount is still within $10 of the best price we’ve seen for the 2TB variant. It’s usually retailed for $230 over the last couple of months. Also at [Best Buy](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=5e0bed65-d2f8-4b34-9b8f-955218c0e37a&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Best+Buy&linkText=Best+Buy&&signature=AQAAAfDWZDY4FnFMHAY0SEGW47U12iJ8xSpom0_KDihmW--R&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fproduct%2Fcrucial-t710-1tb-internal-ssd-pcie-gen-5-x4-nvme-m-2-with-3d-nand-memory%2FJX8PSKC69Z) and [B&H](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=95276f3c-7b79-4c1e-803f-981cd9f7a968&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&featureId=text-link&merchantName=B%26H+Photo&linkText=B%26H&&signature=AQAAAcsVho4F3oVIL1EkJh3RPBkagB6TtE14imMvFBrkZbRU&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bhphotovideo.com%2Fc%2Fproduct%2F1901050-REG%2Fcrucial_ct2000t710ssd8_2tb_t710_nvme_pcie.html).

[**Crucial P310 (2TB) M.2 2230 SSD for $130 at Amazon ($110 off)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0D61SDZD2&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=Crucial+P310+%282TB%29+M.2+2230+SSD+for+%24130+at+Amazon+%28%24110+off%29&&signature=AQAAASxKv0XtQHCvC3eMa_ZX_LK6Q6Y2b0D5DHUfYAhuDktz&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FCrucial-2024-P310-PCIe-Gen4%2Fdp%2FB0D61SDZD2%2F): The P310 is a small-size SSD you can slot in certain thin and light notebooks or gaming handhelds like the [Steam Deck](https://www.engadget.com/steam-deck-oled-review-its-just-better-180038030.html). It uses cheaper QLC memory, not the faster and more durable TLC, but [most](https://www.tweaktown.com/reviews/10790/crucial-p310-2tb-handheld-gaming-ssd-when-qlc-beats-tlc/index.html) [reviews](https://www.tomshardware.com/pc-components/ssds/crucial-p310-ssd-review) [say](https://www.pcworld.com/article/2379686/crucial-p310-nvme-ssd-review.html) it performs well for what it is. This discount is a few bucks above the largest drop we’ve seen for the 2TB model, but it’s still about $20 off the drive’s usual street price. Also at [B&H](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=95276f3c-7b79-4c1e-803f-981cd9f7a968&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&featureId=text-link&merchantName=B%26H+Photo&linkText=B%26H&&signature=AQAAAXfn1qi1WyU5PxPR3WnOFC4f6yCk8P7alPJQalok-vdw&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bhphotovideo.com%2Fc%2Fproduct%2F1835939-REG%2Fcrucial_ct2000p310ssd2_p310_2tb_pcie_gen4.html).

## Best Black Friday portable SSD deals

[**Crucial X10 (1TB) portable SSD for $85 at Amazon ($13 off)**](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0F3377JBN&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=Crucial+X10+%281TB%29+portable+SSD+for+%2485+at+Amazon+%28%2413+off%29&&signature=AQAAARU0js01hbsTPe3yF_gCYABobFKq9yUzV_MR4fWh9X5S&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FCrucial-Portable-External-Compatible-Windows%2Fdp%2FB0F3377JBN%2F): The X10 is a newer iteration of the Crucial X10 Pro, which itself is a variant of the Crucial X9 Pro, the top pick in our guide to the [best portable SSDs](https://www.engadget.com/computing/accessories/best-portable-ssd-120043652.html). It uses the USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 interface, which few PCs and no Macs support, so most people won’t see a difference between it and more traditional USB 3.2 Gen 2 drives like the X9 Pro. (Pricier USB4 and Thunderbolt models, meanwhile, are much faster and generally easier to utilize.)

If the X10 is on sale for much less than the X9 Pro, however, there’s little reason to not buy it instead. That’s the case as of this writing. Plus, like our top pick, the X10 is rugged, impressively compact and fast enough for most people’s needs, though it doesn’t support hardware-based encryption. This deal is $3 more than the 1TB model’s all-time low but still $15 off its typical going rate. Other capacities are also on sale, including the extra spacious [8TB model](https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&itemId=amazon_B0F336NLC7&siteId=us-engadget&pageId=1p-autolink&contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&featureId=text-link&merchantName=Amazon&linkText=8TB+model&&signature=AQAAAbWzSPJyPNvv3m-T9EhZ1lFUJgkWgSD9V4SGNrTEppIJ&gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FCrucial-Portable-External-Compatible-Windows%2Fdp%2FB0F336NLC7%2F) for a new low of $385.
